articles.headline: Gregory Craig Acquitted on Charge of Lying to Justice Department
articles.snippet: Jurors reached a verdict after only hours of deliberation. The trial of Mr. Craig, a former White House counsel, painted an unflattering portrait of Washington lobbying.
articles.abstract: Jurors reached a verdict after only hours of deliberation. The trial of Mr. Craig, a former White House counsel, painted an unflattering portrait of Washington lobbying.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Gregory B. Craig, one of Washington’s most prominent Democratic lawyers, was acquitted on Wednesday of a felony charge that he lied to federal authorities about work he did seven years ago for the Ukrainian government.

articles.headline: His Cat’s Death Left Him Heartbroken. So He Cloned It.
articles.snippet: China’s first duplicate cat marks the country’s emergence in gene research and its entry in a potentially lucrative and unregulated market for cloning pets.
articles.abstract: China’s first duplicate cat marks the country’s emergence in gene research and its entry in a potentially lucrative and unregulated market for cloning pets.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Garlic was dead, and there was nothing Huang Yu could do. So on a cold winter day, he buried his cat’s body in a park close to his home.

articles.headline: Bahamas Stunned as Hurricane Recedes: ‘It’s Like a Bomb Went Off’
articles.snippet: Dorian stripped the Abaco Islands and Grand Bahama of the resources needed to meet basic needs. Twenty people have been confirmed dead — and thousands are at risk.
articles.abstract: Dorian stripped the Abaco Islands and Grand Bahama of the resources needed to meet basic needs. Twenty people have been confirmed dead — and thousands are at risk.
articles.lead_paragraph: TREASURE CAY, Bahamas — The pilot was anxious to help: He had gathered generators, diapers, tuna fish and other supplies. The people living on the islands in the Bahamas devastated by Hurricane Dorian needed them, immediately.
articles.byline: By Kirk Semple, Frances Robles, Rachel Knowles and Elisabeth Malkin

articles.headline: Brexit’s ‘Doomsday Politics’ Mean Voters May Be Last Chance to Resolve Crisis
articles.snippet: A looming election seems to offer the last political mechanism left to end the brawl over Brexit. An inconclusive result could reinforce fears that the problem defies a democratic solution.
articles.abstract: A looming election seems to offer the last political mechanism left to end the brawl over Brexit. An inconclusive result could reinforce fears that the problem defies a democratic solution.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — He jabbed his finger in the air and shook his head theatrically. He dared the opposition to back his call for an election and sneered that the Labour Party’s leader was a “chlorinated chicken.”

articles.headline: Amazon Pushes Fast Shipping but Avoids Responsibility for the Human Cost
articles.snippet: The retail giant directs the destinations, deadlines and routes for its network of contract delivery drivers. But when they crash, Amazon is held harmless.
articles.abstract: The retail giant directs the destinations, deadlines and routes for its network of contract delivery drivers. But when they crash, Amazon is held harmless.
articles.lead_paragraph: When she added Gabrielle’s name to the chart in her kitchen, Judy Kennedy could picture the annual ritual. At birthdays she would ask her newest grandchild to stand up straight, heels against the door frame, so she could mark Gabrielle’s height beside that of her other granddaughter in the Maine house the family has lived in since the 1800s.

articles.headline: In a Tight Labor Market, a Disability May Not Be a Barrier
articles.snippet: To expand the pool of workers, companies are recruiting stay-at-home parents, retirees and people with disabilities. Will they keep it up if the economy sours?
articles.abstract: To expand the pool of workers, companies are recruiting stay-at-home parents, retirees and people with disabilities. Will they keep it up if the economy sours?
articles.lead_paragraph: ROUND ROCK, Tex. — When Kate Cosway completed her master’s degree in 2014, her résumé drew plenty of interest, but she rarely advanced far in the hiring process. She was pretty sure she knew why: She is on the autism spectrum and struggles in traditional interviews.

articles.headline: A Nobel-Winning Economist Goes to Burning Man
articles.snippet: Amid the desert orgies, Paul Romer investigates a provocative question: Is this bacchanal a model of urban planning?
articles.abstract: Amid the desert orgies, Paul Romer investigates a provocative question: Is this bacchanal a model of urban planning?
articles.lead_paragraph: BLACK ROCK CITY, Nev. — It was dusk on the opening night of Burning Man, and the makers and misfits were touching up their art projects and orgy dens. Subwoofers oontz-oontzed as topless cyclists draped in glowing LEDs pedaled through the desert. And Paul Romer, a reigning laureate of the Nobel Prize in economics, sat on a second-story porch at the center of it all, marveling at a subtlety of the street grid.

articles.headline: Shakespearean? Freudian? Jo Johnson, Prime Minister’s Brother, Quits Parliament
articles.snippet: Saying he was “torn between family loyalty and the national interest,” Boris Johnson’s younger brother resigned his ministerial post and his seat in Parliament.
articles.abstract: Saying he was “torn between family loyalty and the national interest,” Boris Johnson’s younger brother resigned his ministerial post and his seat in Parliament.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — They have the same shock of blindingly blond and slightly disheveled hair. They grew up in the same hypercompetitive, overachieving family that held dinner table debates where cleverness was the coin of the realm. They were on opposite sides of the 2016 Brexit referendum but patched things up afterward, as the right sort of people do.

articles.headline: After Breakneck Expansion, WeWork Stumbles as It Nears I.P.O.
articles.snippet: In a sign that investors are growing wary of fast-growing, money-losing start-ups, shares may be offered at a big discount to their January valuation.
articles.abstract: In a sign that investors are growing wary of fast-growing, money-losing start-ups, shares may be offered at a big discount to their January valuation.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the cutthroat world of real estate, WeWork drew envy and admiration as it built an empire of sleek work spaces for freelancers, start-ups and Fortune 500 companies alike.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Peter Eavis
